alert.note: Alert for Antelope Valley; Eastern Antelope Valley Foothills; Eastern San Gabriel Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 20 at 4:50PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...A line of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Los Angeles County including the Antelope Valley and adjacent foothills through 530 PM PDT... At 436 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong and nearly stationary thunderstorm from Lake Los Angeles to Llano, including Highways 18 and 138, as well as the adjacent foothills. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail, along with frequent lightning and heavy downpours, capable of localized flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lake Los Angeles, Wrightwood, Pearblossom, Llano, Littlerock, Valyermo, Saddleback Butte State Park, and Big Pines. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Antelope Valley; Eastern Antelope Valley Foothills; Eastern San Gabriel Mountains
